lines.content: Welcome to Duke, your personal task manager chatbot! Duke is a Java-based project designed to help you efficiently manage your tasks. Whether it's to-do lists, deadlines, or events, Duke has got you covered.
To start using Duke, follow these simple steps:
Download the Latest Release: Navigate to the Releases section of this repository and download the latest ip.jar file. \
Run Duke: Open your terminal or command prompt, and run the following command:
This will launch Duke, and you can start managing your tasks right away!
For detailed instructions on using Duke and its features, please refer to the User Guide located in the docs directory.
Enjoy using Duke to stay organized and boost your productivity! If you encounter any issues or have suggestions for improvement, feel free to open an issue. Your feedback is highly appreciated.
You can add three types of task for Itay to remember:
- Deadline, which has a description and a finish by date and time
- Event, which has a description, a start and an end date and time
You can ask Itay to show you the entire list of tasks.
### Mark and unmark tasks as done
You can tell Itay to mark or unmark some task as done.
You can get Itay to show you all the tasks containing a certain keyword.
You can ask Itay to forget any of the tasks by deleting it.
Adds a todo to the list of tasks.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 8 tasks in the list.
Add a deadline to the list of tasks.
FIN_BY_DATE: finish by date and time of the deadline
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 9 tasks in the list.
Add an event to the list of tasks.
FROM_DT: start date and time of the event
TO_DT: end date and time of the event
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 10 tasks in the list.
Displays the list of all tasks.
Here are the tasks in your list:
7.[E][ ] another project meeting (from: 30 Aug 2023 - 21:00 to: 30 Aug 2023 - 22:00)
Mark a task as done by referencing its index in the list.
INDEX: index of task to be marked as done
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Unmark a task as done by referencing its index in the list.
INDEX: index of task to be unmarked as done
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Find all the tasks containing a specific keyword.
KEYWORD: keyword to find the tasks
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Delete a task by referencing its index in the list.
INDEX: index of task to be marked as done
Got it. I've removed this task:
Now you have 9 tasks in the list.
Exit the Itay bot and save all the current tasks.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
* DukeException is a custom exception class specific to the Duke application.
* It is used to handle and propagate exceptions that occur during the execution of Duke's functionalities.
* Constructs a DukeException with an error message based on the provided error message type.
* @param errMsgType The type of error message to generate.
this.errMsg = "OOPS!!! A command cannot be empty.";
this.errMsg = "OOPS!!! Please enter a valid indicator.";
this.errMsg = "OOPS!!! Deadline command must be of form: deadline ___ /by ___.";
this.errMsg = "OOPS!!! Event command must be of form: event ___ /from ___ /to ___.";
this.errMsg = "OOPS!!! Please enter a valid task number.";
this.errMsg = "OOPS!!! The description of a command cannot be empty.";
this.errMsg = "OOPS!!! I don't know what that means.";
* The ErrorMessageType enum defines various error message types that can be generated
* during the execution of the Duke application. Each enum value represents a specific type

* Represents a task with a type, description, status, and time details (if applicable).

* The time field stores additional information like the deadline or event times.

* @param type The type of the task (T for Todo, D for Deadline, E for Event).
* @throws DukeException If an illegal value for the task type is provided.

* The TaskList class represents a list of tasks in the Duke application.
* It manages tasks using Java's ArrayList methods, providing functionality to access,
* add, and remove tasks from the list.
* Represents the user interface for the Duke application.
* The Ui class handles interactions with the user, including reading commands,
* printing messages, and displaying task information.
* Prints the introductory message when the application starts.
println("What can I do for you?");
* Prints the exit message when the application terminates.
println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints the list of tasks, including their descriptions and statuses.
println("You have no tasks in your list.");
println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Prints the list of tasks that match a specified keyword in their descriptions.
* @param foundTasks A TaskList containing tasks that match the keyword.
println("You have no matching tasks in your list.");
println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Prints a message to indicate that a task has been marked as done.
* @param taskIdx The index of the task to mark.
println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Prints a message to indicate that a task has been unmarked.
* @param taskIdx The index of the task to unmark.
println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Prints a message to indicate that a task has been deleted from the task list.

* Prints a message to indicate that a task has been added to the task list.
